text: Our next topic is linear equations or really systems of linear equations,
which are very conveniently represented using matrix vector notation.
So, ah, uh, a set of linear equations,
uh, it's a set of m linear equations in n variables.
The n- the variables are gonna be called by, well, by tradition,
but they could be called anything,
x_1 up to x_n.
Um, and there's m equations.
Each equation looks like this.
It's a, it's a set of coefficients.
It's like capital A_11x_1 plus A_12x_2 up to A_1nx_n equals b_1.

it's the way people call it.

a vector called x, uh,
that's called the variable or the unknowns in the, in the equation.

those are called the coefficients in the system of linear equations.

um, that matrix is called the coefficient matrix of your system of linear equations.

it's called the right-hand side.

there are fewer equations than there are variables, okay?

if m equals n. That means there's, you know, there, for example,
there's 20 variables, 20 equations, okay?
So that's called a square system of linear equations.
